w:HTMLPanel.title: PWT - Tutorial Part 1 - Init a PWT Project with Maven

w:Header.w:Heading: Part 1 - Init a PWT Project with Maven

w:HTMLPanel.p: In this tutorial, we will init a PWT project named putnami-pwt-tutorial from scratch.

w:Alert.p: In this tutorial, we use Maven to build the project. If you use Gradle, you should see the Gradle version here

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 1 : Create the project folder
w:HTMLPanel.p: Just create the project root folder named "putnami-pwt-tutorial".
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 2 : Create the build script
w:HTMLPanel.p: In the project folder, create the maven build file (pom.xml).
We will configure the maven build :

ol.li:
Init the build script by adding our maven repository :
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion> <groupId>fr.putnami.pwt</groupId> <artifactId>putnami-pwt-tutorial</artifactId> <packaging>war</packaging> <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version> <name>Putnami Web Toolkit tutorial web app</name>
<repositories> <repository> <id>putnami.org</id> <url>http://repo.putnami.org/</url> </repository> </repositories> </project>

Now we add the needed dependencies : :
<properties> <gwt.version>2.6.1</gwt.version> </properties>
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>fr.putnami.pwt</groupId> <artifactId>pwt</artifactId> <version>@releaseVersion@</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>com.google.gwt</groupId> <artifactId>gwt-user</artifactId> <version>${gwt.version}</version> <scope>provided</scope> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>com.google.gwt</groupId> <artifactId>gwt-servlet</artifactId> <version>${gwt.version}</version> </dependency> </dependencies>

And now we configure the needed plugins (compiler-plugin, war-plugin, gwt-plugin, jetty-plugin) :
<properties> ... <jetty.plugin.version>9.2.0.v20140526</jetty.plugin.version> <project.compiler.source>1.7</project.compiler.source> <project.compiler.target>1.7</project.compiler.target> <project.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.sourceEncoding> <webappDirectory>${project.build.directory}/${project.build.finalName}</webappDirectory> </properties>
<build> <outputDirectory>${webappDirectory}/WEB-INF/classes</outputDirectory> <pluginManagement> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId> <version>3.1</version> <configuration> <source>${project.compiler.source}</source> <target>${project.compiler.target}</target> <encoding>${project.sourceEncoding}</encoding> </configuration> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-war-plugin</artifactId> <version>2.4</version> <executions> <execution> <phase>compile</phase> <goals> <goal>exploded</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <webappDirectory>${webappDirectory}</webappDirectory> </configuration> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>gwt-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>${gwt.version}</version> <executions> <execution> <goals> <goal>compile</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <!--Your host Page if using dev mode --> <runTarget>/index.html</runTarget> <modules> <module>fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.Tutorial</module> </modules> <hostedWebapp>${webappDirectory}</hostedWebapp> </configuration> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.eclipse.jetty</groupId> <artifactId>jetty-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>${jetty.plugin.version}</version> <configuration> <webAppSourceDirectory>${webappDirectory}</webAppSourceDirectory> <contextPath>/</contextPath> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </pluginManagement> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-war-plugin</artifactId> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>gwt-maven-plugin</artifactId> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.eclipse.jetty</groupId> <artifactId>jetty-maven-plugin</artifactId> </plugin> </plugins> </build>

Finally we add a profile to use the superDev mode: :
<profiles> <profile> <id>dev</id> <build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>gwt-maven-plugin</artifactId> <executions> <execution> <phase>compile</phase> <goals> <goal>compile</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <modules> <module>fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.TutorialDev</module> </modules> <draftCompile>true</draftCompile> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </build> </profile> </profiles>

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 3 : Init the folders
w:HTMLPanel.p: Now we have a great build script, we need to init the folders.
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 4 : Create an Entry point and a Module Xml file
w:HTMLPanel.p: Now, as a GWT application, we need to create a Module xml file and an entry point.

ol.li:
In the build script configuration, we've used the "fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.Tutorial" module so we juste have to create it by creating the file fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/Tutorial.gwt.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <module rename-to="Tutorial"> <!-- PWT Module to extends in order to use PWT widgets--> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.core.widget.Widget"/>
<entry-point class="fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.client.TutorialApp"/>
<!-- This linker will be the default one in later version of GWT --> <add-linker name="xsiframe" /> </module>

li.p: We also create a GWT module file for the dev tasks : fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/TutorialDev.gwt.xml

c:StaticCode.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <module rename-to="Tutorial"> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.tutorial.Tutorial" />
<!-- We collapse all properties --> <collapse-property name="user.agent" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="locale" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="canvasElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="touchEventSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="dragEventSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="audioElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="videoElementSupport" values="*" /> <collapse-property name="storageSupport" values="*" />
<set-configuration-property name="devModeRedirectEnabled" value="true" /> </module>

w:Alert.p: In the dev module, we do not use the collapse-all-properties tag because it induce a bug in source mapping in browsers.

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 5 : Create the host HTML file
w:HTMLPanel.p: Create the src/main/webapp/index.html host file, containing :

c:StaticCode.pre: <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>PWT - Putnami Web Toolkit - Tutorial</title> <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"> <script type="text/javascript" src="Tutorial/Tutorial.nocache.js"></script> </head> <body> <noscript>Your browser does not support JavaScript!</noscript> </body> </html>>
